intro: Monopyle leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered monopyle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and are often fragrant. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes.
